data.chText: 瞥一眼；匆匆一看；扫视
data.enText: to look quickly at sth/sb

data.chText: 她匆匆看了看表。
data.enText: She glanced at her watch.

data.chText: 他环视了一下房间。
data.enText: He glanced around the room.

data.chText: 我迅速抬头瞥了一眼看是谁进来了。
data.enText: I glanced up quickly to see who had come in.

data.chText: 浏览；粗略地看
data.enText: to read sth quickly and not thoroughly

data.chText: 我只来得及浏览了一下报纸。
data.enText: I only had time to glance at the newspapers.

data.chText: 他草草看了一遍名单。
data.enText: He glanced briefly down the list of names.

data.chText: 她大致浏览了一下报告。
data.enText: She glanced through the report.
glance on/off sth

data.chText: 在…上闪烁（或闪耀）；从…中反射
data.enText: to flash on a surface or be reflected off it
glance off (sth)

data.chText: 斜向击中（某物）后改变方向
data.enText: to hit sth at an angle and move off it in a different direction

data.chText: 球击中门柱后弹入网内。
data.enText: The ball glanced off the post into the net.

data.chText: 匆匆一看；一瞥；扫视
data.enText: a quick look

data.chText: 匆匆看一眼报纸的大标题
data.enText: to take/have a glance at the newspaper headlines

data.chText: 草草的 / 短暂的 / 不经意的 / 偷偷的一瞥
data.enText: a cursory/brief/casual/furtive glance

data.chText: 姐妹们相互对视了一下。
data.enText: The sisters exchanged glances (= looked at each other) .

data.chText: 她从眼角瞥了他一眼。
data.enText: She shot him a sideways glance .

data.chText: 他头也不回地扬长而去。
data.enText: He walked away without a backward glance .

data.chText: 她偷偷看了看表。
data.enText: She stole a glance (= looked secretly) at her watch.
at a (single) glance

data.chText: 立刻；一眼；（只）看一眼
data.enText: immediately; with only a quick look

data.chText: 他一眼就看出了问题所在。
data.enText: He could tell at a glance what was wrong.
at first glance

data.chText: 乍一看；乍看之下
data.enText: when you first look at or think about sth, often rather quickly

data.chText: 乍一看问题似乎很简单。
data.enText: At first glance the problem seemed easy.

data.text: look ♦ glance ♦ gaze ♦ stare ♦ glimpse ♦ glare

data.chText: 以上各词均表示看的动作。
data.enText: These are all words for an act of looking, when you turn your eyes in a particular direction.
look

data.chText: 指看、瞧：
data.enText: an act of looking at sb/sth

data.chText: 来，看一看这个。
data.enText: Here, have a look at this.
glance

data.chText: 指匆匆一看、一瞥、扫视：
data.enText: a quick look

data.chText: 她偷偷看了看表。
data.enText: She stole a glance at her watch.
gaze

data.chText: 指凝视、注视：
data.enText: a long steady look at sb/sth

data.chText: 她在他凝视的目光下感到很尴尬。
data.enText: She felt embarrassed under his steady gaze.
stare

data.chText: 尤指不友善或吃惊的盯、凝视、注视：
data.enText: a long look at sb/sth, especially in a way that is unfriendly or that shows surprise

data.chText: 她面无表情地盯着那官员，耸了耸肩。
data.enText: She gave the officer a blank stare and shrugged her shoulders.
glimpse

data.chText: 指一瞥、一看：
data.enText: a look at sb/sth for a very short time, when you do not see the person or thing completely

data.chText: 他在人群里一眼瞥见了她。
data.enText: He caught a glimpse of her in the crowd.
glare

data.chText: 指长久的怒视、瞪眼：
data.enText: a long angry look at sb/sth

data.chText: 她敌意地瞪着向她提问的人。
data.enText: She fixed her questioner with a hostile glare.
a look/glance/gaze/stare/glare at sth
a glimpse of sb/sth
with a look/glance/stare/glare
a long/penetrating/piercing look/glance/gaze/stare/glare
a brief look/glance/glimpse/glare
to give sb a look/glance/stare/glare
to have/get/take/sneak/steal a look/glance/glimpse
to avoid sb's look/glance/gaze/stare

ex.chText: 她向房间四周看了一眼才离开。
ex.enText: She glanced about the room before she left.

ex.chText: 她从他身边走过时，他快速地瞟了她一眼。
ex.enText: He glanced at her as she passed by.
He glimpsed a figure at the window.

ex.chText: 在她即将消失在人群中时，我瞥见了她。
ex.enText: I glimpsed her among the crowd before she disappeared from sight.

synonyms.bx: 指一瞥之下看见某人或某物，但未看清全貌。

ex.chText: 哈里从窗户往厨房里窥视。
ex.enText: Harry peeped through the window into the kitchen.
He peeped through the key hole.

synonyms.bx: 尤指通过孔眼、缝隙等迅速地偷窥。

data.enText: at a (single) glance

data.chText: 立刻；一眼；（只）看一眼
data.enText: immediately; with only a quick look

data.chText: 他一眼就看出了问题所在。
data.enText: He could tell at a glance what was wrong.
at first glance

data.chText: 乍一看；乍看之下
data.enText: when you first look at or think about sth, often rather quickly

data.chText: 乍一看问题似乎很简单。
data.enText: At first glance the problem seemed easy.
glance on/off sth

data.chText: 在…上闪烁（或闪耀）；从…中反射
data.enText: to flash on a surface or be reflected off it
glance off (sth)

data.chText: 斜向击中（某物）后改变方向
data.enText: to hit sth at an angle and move off it in a different direction

data.chText: 球击中门柱后弹入网内。
data.enText: The ball glanced off the post into the net.

example: She only glanced at the paper
I only peeked--I didn't see anything interesting

value.def: If you glance at something or someone, you look at them very quickly and then look away again immediately.
If you glance through or at a newspaper, report, or book, you spend a short time looking at it without reading it very carefully.

example.ex: I picked up the phone book and glanced through it...
example.tran: 我拿起电话簿，匆匆扫了一遍。

example.ex: I never even glanced at the political page of a daily paper.
example.tran: 我对日报的政治版从来连看都不看。

value.def: A glance is a quick look at someone or something.

example.ex: Trevor and I exchanged a glance.
example.tran: 特雷弗和我迅速交换了一下眼色。

example.ex: ...stealing a quick glance at her watch.

value.def: If you see something at a glance, you see or recognize it immediately, and without having to think or look carefully.

example.ex: One could tell at a glance that she was a compassionate person.
example.tran: 一眼就能看出她很有同情心。

value.def: If you say that something is true or seems to be true at first glance, you mean that it seems to be true when you first see it or think about it, but that your first impression may be wrong.

example.ex: At first glance, organic farming looks much more expensive for the farmer.
example.tran: 乍一看，有机耕作对农民而言似乎花费大多了。

value.def: If you steal a glance at someone or something, you look at them quickly so that nobody sees you looking.

example.ex: He stole a glance at the clock behind her.
example.tran: 他偷偷地看了一眼她背后的钟。

gramarinfo.label: V and N inflect, oft PHR <l>at</l> n
